Package com.passwordmanager.crypto

Class AesGcmProvider

java.lang.Object
com.passwordmanager.crypto.AesGcmProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
EncryptionProvider
public final class AesGcmProvider extends Object implements EncryptionProvider
AES-GCM encryption provider with configurable security profiles.

Algorithm: AES-GCM (Galois/Counter Mode)

  • Authenticated Encryption with Associated Data (AEAD)
  • Provides both confidentiality and authenticity
  • Resistant to padding oracle attacks
  • Efficient hardware acceleration on modern CPUs

Security Properties:

  • IVs are generated using SecureRandom
  • IV uniqueness is cryptographically guaranteed
  • Authentication tag is verified before decryption
  • No plaintext is returned if authentication fails

Key Derivation:

This provider expects a 256-bit key from VaultSession.getVaultSessionKey(). For profiles requiring different key sizes:

  • 128-bit profiles: Truncates the 256-bit key (uses first 16 bytes)
  • 256-bit profiles: Uses the full key

Note: Truncation is cryptographically sound when the source key has sufficient entropy (which PBKDF2 with 600k iterations guarantees).

Thread Safety:

This class is thread-safe. Each operation creates a new Cipher instance, avoiding shared mutable state.

Performance Characteristics:

  • FAST profile: ~1-2 GB/s on modern hardware
  • BALANCED profile: ~800 MB/s - 1.5 GB/s
  • PARANOID profile: ~800 MB/s - 1.5 GB/s (slight overhead from larger IV)

Actual performance depends on CPU, JVM, and data size.

Limitations:

  • Maximum plaintext size: ~64 GB (GCM counter limit)
  • Maximum operations per key: 2^32 (IV collision risk)
  • Key must be rotated before these limits are reached

  • Constructor Details

    • AesGcmProvider

      public AesGcmProvider(SecurityProfile profile)
      Constructs an AES-GCM provider with the specified security profile.

      The profile determines key size, IV size, and authentication tag size.

      Parameters:
      profile - the security profile to use
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if profile is null or incompatible

  • Method Details

    • encrypt

      public EncryptionResult encrypt(byte[] plaintext, SecretKey key) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Description copied from interface: EncryptionProvider
      Encrypts plaintext using authenticated encryption.

      Guarantees:

      • Generates a cryptographically random IV/nonce
      • IV is unique and never reused
      • Returns ciphertext with embedded authentication tag
      • Original plaintext is NOT modified

      Caller Responsibilities:

      • Zeroize plaintext array after encryption if sensitive
      • Store the returned EncryptionResult securely
      • Use the same key for decryption
      Specified by:
      encrypt in interface EncryptionProvider
      Parameters:
      plaintext - the data to encrypt (must not be null or empty)
      key - the encryption key (must match profile's key size)
      Returns:
      an EncryptionResult containing IV and ciphertext
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if encryption fails

    • decrypt

      public byte[] decrypt(EncryptionResult encrypted, SecretKey key) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Description copied from interface: EncryptionProvider
      Decrypts an encrypted result using authenticated decryption.

      Security Guarantees:

      • Verifies authentication tag before returning plaintext
      • Throws exception if tag verification fails (tampering detected)
      • Returns plaintext only if authentication succeeds

      Caller Responsibilities:

      • Zeroize returned plaintext after use
      • Handle authentication failures appropriately
      • Use the same key that was used for encryption
      Specified by:
      decrypt in interface EncryptionProvider
      Parameters:
      encrypted - the encryption result to decrypt
      key - the decryption key (must match encryption key)
      Returns:
      the decrypted plaintext
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if decryption fails or authentication fails

    • getProfile

      public SecurityProfile getProfile()
      Description copied from interface: EncryptionProvider
      Returns the security profile used by this provider.

      The profile determines all cryptographic parameters including algorithm, key size, IV size, and tag size.

      Specified by:
      getProfile in interface EncryptionProvider
      Returns:
      the security profile

    • isValidKey

      public boolean isValidKey(SecretKey key)
      Description copied from interface: EncryptionProvider
      Validates that a key is compatible with this provider's profile.

      This method checks key size and type. It does NOT verify key strength or entropy (which must be ensured during key derivation).

      Specified by:
      isValidKey in interface EncryptionProvider
      Parameters:
      key - the key to validate
      Returns:
      true if the key is valid for this provider
